abstract: Fixed-income revenue at Wall Street firms could shrink 25 percent as a result of the Volcker Rule, estimated Brad Hintz, an analyst with Sanford C. Bernstein, according to Bloomberg News.
snippet: Fixed-income revenue at Wall Street firms could shrink 25 percent as a result of the Volcker Rule, estimated Brad Hintz, an analyst with Sanford C. Bernstein, according to Bloomberg News.

keywords.name: subject
keywords.value: Dodd-Frank Wall Street Reform and Consumer Protection Act (2010)

lead_paragraph: Fixed-income revenue at Wall Street firms could shrink by 25 percent as a result of the Volcker Rule, estimated Brad Hintz, an analyst with Sanford C. Bernstein, according to Bloomberg News. Regulators will start issuing drafts of the rule on Tuesday. Read more »
